==Japanese==

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|まど|べ}}
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=まどべ|窓|tr1=mado|t1=window|辺|tr2=be|t2=vicinity, area near something}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|まどべ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|まどべ}}

# the [[area]] near a [[window]], the [[vicinity]] of a window
#: {{ja-usex|'''窓辺'''に立ったら日当たりがよくなるけど。|'''まどべ''' に たったら ひあたり が よく なる けど。|You'll get better sun if you stand '''by the window'''.}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|そう|へん}}
Either from {{der|ja|ltc|sort=そうへん|窗邊|tr=tsrhæwng pen|lit=window + border; location}}, or coined in Japan from {{etyl|ltc|-}}-derived components.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=go|そうへん}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|そうへん|hhira=さうへん}}

# the [[area]] near a [[window]], the [[vicinity]] of a window

=====Usage notes=====
This reading seems to be very rare.
